item.title: Abolish ICE DenverCommunity E(Check the down below or comments section for sources)‚Äº‚Äº‚Äº Even before the tragedy that happened last...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverCommunity E

(Check the down below or comments section for sources)‚Äº‚Äº‚Äº

Even before the tragedy that happened last night there were reports of Police departments that were PU...RPOSELY allowing right-wing supremacist to brutalize BLM protestors as a way of sending a message.
The cops can do this because they know that qualified immunity prevents them from being sued for their negligence. If they encourage violence and someone gets hurt, like with last night, THEY can always avoid being sued for their misconduct.
But it doesn't have to be like this. There is a bill currently in the US House of Representative that would remove Q.I. It won't end racism and corruption in our government, but it's a start to accountability. We NEED you to demand your Congress representatives to get this passed. Links to help you will be provided in the comments, but please share this post.

1) https://www.huffpost.com/‚Ä¶/portland-police-far-right-proud-‚Ä¶

2) https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/7085

3) https://www.house.gov/representa.../find-your-representative

4) https://www.senate.gov/.../contact.../senators_cfm.cfm

item.title: Please support this bail fund for Denver demonstrators who were...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Please support this bail fund for Denver demonstrators who were arrested on Saturday August 22, 200 for confronting the Denver Police Department for what it is: a violently racist and authoritarian institution.

After years of police murder and terrorizing our unhoused neighbors, we are FED UP! Last Wednesday, when 40+ DPD officers brutalized community members assisting unhoused neighbors with sweeps, we drew a line in the sand. Enough is enough and we demand justice for our ...unhoused neighbors, the families of our black and brown neighbors murdered by DPD and the thousands of people in our city impacted by state-backed violence. The Denver City Council has failed to hear our calls for justice, liberation and abolition and we know that human rights only come alive when citizens organize, protest, boycott, rebel and violate the law in order to uphold justice.

Twelve comrades were arrested last night. Some were released on PR bond but we still have 3 bonds of $500 each to pay and two comrades with bond not allowed until court on Monday afternoon. Please help pay ransom for these brave rebels and get them out of cages with an active COVID outbreak! Let's get our comrades back to their loved ones, their pets and their jobs tonight!

Venmo: @LoveLionHippopotamus

As the election approaches we are looking to make an active bail fund for rebels and any excess monies will be put into this revolving fund as we work to create it! We will update this post when fundraising goals gave been met!

Love, Solidarity & Power
üö©üè¥üñ§‚ù§‚úäüî•

item.title: #FreeThemAll ‚Äú10 of the top 10 infection clusters in the...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

#FreeThemAll
‚Äú10 of the top 10 infection clusters in the United States are linked to correctional facilities. Of the top 100 clusters, 87 are tied to detention centers. It is morbidly unsurprising that the virus is ravaging jails and prisons, where cramped quarters make social distancing impossible. Prisons are increasingly relying on lockdowns to restrict movement, leading to a staggering jump in the number of people in isolation or solitary confinement. Half of all states are not requiring correctional staff to wear masks. Matters are made worse by insufficient sanitation materials, and, all too often, a culture of cruelty and disregard for the well-being of incarcerated people.‚Äù

As cases soar among inmates, decarceration efforts are lagging.

washingtonpost.com

Opinion | Coronavirus cases in prisons are exploding. More people need to be let out.

As cases soar among inmates, decarceration efforts are lagging.As cases soar among inmates, decarceration efforts are lagging.

item.title: ‚ÄúLo botaron de su habitaci√≥n porque se qued√≥ sin trabajo‚Äù...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

‚ÄúLo botaron de su habitaci√≥n porque se qued√≥ sin trabajo‚Äù

‚ÄúBuenas tardes, me acerco a ustedes por lo siguiente‚Äù, nos dijo Jairo, un guatemalteco preocupado por el siguiente caso:

‚ÄúCuando yo encontr√© a Don Miguel, el ya ten√≠a 2 semanas de andar durmiendo en la estaci√≥n de Maverick, yo me compromet√≠ a conseguirle un cuarto y pagarlo yo pero la muchacha que me lo rent√≥ quiere rentar ese cuarto a otra persona un poco m√°s caro entonces yo quiero ver si ustedes podr√≠an orientarme o... ayudarme a conseguirle alg√∫n tipo de Housing, don Miguel es de El Salvador, tiene 72 a√±os, cuenta con permiso de trabajo, tiene seguro social y est√° solo en Estados Unidos‚Äù

‚ÄúEl necesita ayuda, est√° solo, he tocado puertas en Chelsea pero nadie me ayuda, a don Miguel lo votaron sin raz√≥n alguna‚Äù

Si alg√∫n lector u organizaci√≥n, pudiera ayudarnos, puede contactar a:
Jairo Mendoza al 857-258-6858 o si desea conversar directamente con don Miguel: 617-952-1892

item.title: V√≠a La Resistencia We've confirmed that Victor is back at...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

V√≠a La Resistencia We've confirmed that Victor is back at NWDC‚Äîfor now. You all mobilized quickly this morning to show up with banners and signs at the airport, to contact the director of ICE‚Äôs Seattle field office, to share our livestreams and calls to action. That pressure halted Victor's deportation for now!

But the fight isn't over. We‚Äôre told that Victor will likely face deportation next week. We want him reunited with his wife and children in Pasco. We want him free. An...d we want NWDC shut down once and for all.

We've known all along that ICE lies, but today we saw once again that nothing they say can be trusted. We saw once again that ICE won't hesitate to send people to their deaths. The Mexican consulate must not be complicit in this violence.
üö®üö®üö®üö®üö®üö®üö®üö®
We need to flood the phone lines at consulate offices in both Seattle and San Diego to urge staff not to collaborate with ICE on Victor's deportation.

Seattle:
Farid Alejandro Soberanis Garcia
(206) 448-3526‚Äã dial 5 then ext.101
fsoberanis@sre.gob.mx
Twitter: @ConsulmexSEA
Facebook: @ConsulMexSEA

San Diego:
Victor Esponda
(619) 231-8414
Twitter: @consulmexsdi
Facebook: @Consulmexsd
vesponda@sre.gob.mx
If email bounces, tag @Consulmexsd and tweet @carlos_glezgtez

Sample Script:
‚Äú'I‚Äôm calling/e-mailing you as a ‚Äã(fill in... WA resident, WA teacher, parent, community member, etc.)‚Äã to ask that you‚Äã refuse to collaborate with ICE on the deportation of ViÃÅctor JimeÃÅnez GutieÃÅrrez.‚Äã Mr. JimeÃÅnez GutieÃÅrrez is a 62 year-old blind man, having lost his sight due to diabetic complications. ICE terrorizes our communities and knowingly sends people to their deaths by deporting people like Mr JimeÃÅnez with serious illnesses and disabilities. The consulate must not collaborate with ICE in carrying out this violent agenda. Deportations and detention during this global pandemic put all of us at risk. The time to act on ending immigration detention is now, and the consulate has a central role to play.‚Äù
‚úäüèª‚úäüèº‚úäüèΩ‚úäüèæ‚úäüèø
Join us at 1pm this Sunday 8/23 for a ‚Äãrally‚Äã outside NWDC. We‚Äôll share updates on Victor‚Äôs case, on the two people who were recently detained in Bend, and on the four youth currently detained at a county jail in Cowlitz.
#fuckice #chingalamigra #not1more

item.title: California activists have demonstrated outside Palantir's...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

California activists have demonstrated outside Palantir's Palo Alto HQ about a dozen times in the last year, bringing thousands to the streets demanding they leave town.

We can't wait to do the same in Colorado. #NoTechforICE

The company listed Denver as its headquarters on its company website, among the other cities and countries it operates in. It also updated its social media pages to reflect a Colorado move.

cnbc.com

Palantir to relocate headquarters from Silicon Valley to Colorado

The company listed Denver as its headquarters on its company website, among the other cities and countries it operates in. item.title: "The only jail in Oregon that holds federal immigration...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The only jail in Oregon that holds federal immigration detainees has said it will end the practice.

The board that oversees the Northern Oregon Regional Correctional Facility in The Dalles unanimously agreed on Thursday to initiate steps toward ending its contract with U.S. Immigration Customs and Enforcement. The board declined an interview to explain what brought about the decision or the fiscal impact. But said in a statement the overall number detainees has dropped resulting in less revenue for the jail."

The board that oversees the Northern Oregon Regional Correctional Facility in The Dalles unanimously agreed on Thursday to initiate steps to end its contract with Immigration Customs and Enforcement.

opb.org

NORCOR, last jail in Oregon to hold immigration detainees, to end ICE contract

The board that oversees the Northern Oregon Regional Correctional Facility in The Dalles unanimously agreed on Thursday to initiate steps to end its contract with Immigration Customs and Enforcement.The board that oversees the Northern Oregon Regional Correctional Facility in The Dalles unanimously agreed on Thursday to initiate steps to end its contract with Immigration Customs and Enforcement.

item.content:encoded: When we arrived to the camp near GEO, the gulch was full of dumped trash and the grass littered in glass; we cleaned up a lot last week and are coming back tomorrow and Saturday to leave the Sand Creek cleaner than we found it! Come on by with gloves, bags, water and snacks! 3130 Oakland St, Aurora
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement...
item.content:encoded:
Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) was planning an operation to target thousands of immigrant families that have received final deportation orders- a carefully coordinated push that was to target on up to 10 "sanctuary" cities across the country.

Many of us in the Coalition to Close the Concentation Camps knew that it was time to take action against forces of fascism and evil- especially for our families impacted by this broken immigration system. On July 12, 2019, radicals and impacted families split from the milquetoast Lights for Liberty vigil being conducted at the Aurora ICE Processing Center. Rebels marched into the parking lot of GEO- where anticolonial speeches were given by indigenous youth and where the now infamous flag removal occurred.

Following the flag removal and international embarrassment, the Aurora Police Department began a Twitter manhunt offering a $4k reward to identify suspects from that evening; violent crimes typically only get a $1k reward and we knew this outrageously large reward was made because two anti police flags were flown that night. Cowards at APD wouldn't fire or prosecute the murderers of Elijah McClain the following month, yet APD had the time and resources to target non-violent protestors demanding justice for immigrants.

The woman featured in this powerful photo, Michelle, was eventually identified by non profit "allies" and served misdemeanor tampering charges; Michelle's case with Aurora dragged on for over a year. Today we have some good news: our hero was found NOT GUILTY by jury trial and walks free of all charges! Fuck APD!

Michelle- you are an inspiration and a true Chingona. With you, our city sent a message to the Department of Homeland Security. Your bravery, in addition to the life Willem Van Spronsen gave on July 13th 2019 by setting ICE's kidnapping vans in Tacoma ablaze, made ICE retreat on their planned nationwide mass arrests of immigrants.

#ChingaLaMigra #AbolishICE
Photo by @buffalo_heart_images
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the...
item.content:encoded:
"All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the authority to transfer us immediately if we want," says Jimmy Sodhi, a 45-year-old ICE detainee.

Sodhi is part of a group of eight ICE detainees who have been housed in the same dormitory at the Teller County Jail since being transferred there from the Aurora Contract Detention Facility one month ago. Sodhi and the other ICE detainees began the hunger strike on the morning of August 10 to protest what they allege are significantly worse conditions at Aurora GEO.

"As a Sikh, I'm not allowed to wear my Sikh bracelet, I'm not allowed to cover my head. If I have to pray, it's required for me to cover my head. I'm told to cover my head with a pillowcase or a towel," says Sodhi, who has been in ICE custody since March 2017 and is currently in the appeals process of his deportation case stemming from a fraud conviction for insider trading. "That is very demeaning, very disrespectful."

Sodhi notes that he was allowed to wear his turban at the Aurora detention facility, but has been told by staff at the Teller County Jail that he cannot retrieve his turban from his personal belongings. Same with prayer books, Sodhi adds, which he hasn't been able to obtain, being told by staff that "there's no chaplain here and we don't have those here."

Additionally, Sodhi contends that he and other ICE detainees at the Teller County Jail have been subjected to racial harassment perpetrated by non-ICE detainees staying in the same dormitory.

[...]

Adding to his angst, Sodhi contends that he and the other detainees don't even know why they're being housed in the Teller County Jail, which has an agreement with ICE to house immigrant detainees.

Via @denverwestword @conormichael28
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Rest is radical and Camp #FreeThemAll has voted to lift up camp to allow our beloved community to rest and renew. We are...
item.content:encoded:
Rest is radical and Camp #FreeThemAll has voted to lift up camp to allow our beloved community to rest and renew. We are still in this fight for the long haul - aka until we #FreeThemAll.

Camp Free Them All has been a success in that we: saved lives, forced Aurora GEO to be one of two detention centers in the so-called United States to be offering COVID testing, forced a congressional hearing on COVID in ICE detection centers, stopped an illegal deporation, supported families with your love & money and built so much power together this summer! ‚úäüíñ

Despite these successes, we found out last week that nearly a third of the detainees are now being quarantined due to COVID and we fully intend to keep up the pressure on GEO, ICE & DHS.

Stay tuned for our next steps at Aurora GEO and if you want to help keep impacted families out of ICE custody, please donate directly to families!

Venmo: Sanctuary-4-All
Cashapp: $abolishicedenver

Tomorrow we ask that you please come get your belongings or contact us about storage. Any items not picked up will be given to unhoused neighbors and other struggles for liberation.

And please join us for a special Sunday vigil and Pablo's birthday celebration!

https://facebook.com/events/s/pablos-birthday-vigil/749228552534363/?ti=cl
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: The number of people quarantined at Aurora GEO has nearly doubled in one week. @repjasoncrow has been busy touring Air...
item.content:encoded:
The number of people quarantined at Aurora GEO has nearly doubled in one week. @repjasoncrow has been busy touring Air Force bases and isn't doing enough to address the threat of COVID 19 facing immigrants detained at the concentration camp in his district.

GEO and ICE cannot be trusted with the care of anyone in their custody and we demand that they #FreeThemAll
